H0.text: Glaciers are the solid bodies of ice that contain most of the fresh water on Earth.

H1.text: Sediments are the solid forms that hold most of the fresh water on Earth.

H2.text: Lakes are the majority of fresh water on earth tied up in a solid form.

H3.text: Oceans are the solid form in which most of the fresh water on earth is tied up.

A4.text: Glacial ice is the largest reservoir of fresh water on Earth, holding about 69% of the world's freshwater with ice sheets.

A5.text: Sediments such as till and outwash are deposited by glaciers and consist of a mixture of undifferentiated material ranging from clay size to boulders.
